title: 212: Plato's Dialogue, "Euthyphro"
dc:creator: A.J. Hanenburg
description: As Socrates waits in line for his own trial, he chats up a fellow named Euthyphro who plans to denounce his own father. They end up discussing the definition of piety until Euthyphro politely excuses himself from the conversation.
itunes:author: Three Pious Fellows who totally know what piety is
itunes:subtitle: "I have to leave now."
itunes:summary: As Socrates waits in line for his own trial, he chats up a fellow named Euthyphro who plans to denounce his own father. They end up discussing the definition of piety until Euthyphro politely excuses himself from the conversation.
itunes:title: 212: Plato's Dialogue, "Euthyphro"
